meanings.definition: Material used to soften or protect a surface.
meanings.sent1: I put some soft padding on the chair to make it more comfortable.
meanings.sent2: The helmet had padding inside to keep the head safe during sports.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the padding on the bed so cozy, it refused to move.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words acted as emotional padding during a difficult time.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy padding on the carpet felt like walking on clouds.

meanings.definition: Superfluous material added to increase size or weight.
meanings.sent1: The costume had extra padding to make the actor look bigger.
meanings.sent2: The package had unnecessary padding that made it bulky to carry.
meanings.sent3: The cake had so much padding of frosting that it looked like a mountain.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were like mental padding to avoid facing the truth.
meanings.sent5: The tree's thick padding of leaves made it seem larger than life.

meanings.definition: The act of filling out or extending something.
meanings.sent1: The padding of extra details in the story made it more interesting.
meanings.sent2: Her padding of the essay with examples improved its quality.
meanings.sent3: The padding of time before the meeting allowed for more preparation.
meanings.sent4: His padding of the speech with jokes kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent5: The padding of the conversation with compliments made her feel appreciated.
